item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @amt amt
item.description:
@amt wrote:

my compiler does not work.

@echo off
:menu
title Sk1ttlezrule43v Compiler
echo Errors:
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Compiling Finished.
pause
exit

this is what the code is and the error is

the system cannot find the path.

I know the problem is for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") but idk what to change it to i tried just changing the c to d nothing i have the newest jdk also.

Read full topic
